I think the first thing that came into all of our minds when we first saw a Mun arch is, 'I wonder if I can get my orbit to pass through that?'

That\'s the challenge! To really pass, your periapsis should be above the surface for at least one full orbit before passing through the arch. That is, you can\'t take off a kilometer from the arch, accelerate horizontally toward the arch to orbital velocity and pass through immediately. That wouldn\'t really be orbiting through it. However, you can make corrections to your orbit as often and as late as you want.

Post a shot of your ship passing through the arch, and also a map view shot of your orbit.

Here\'s my entry, passing through the one arch whose location I know

I did some surveying of the target arch and then wrote a bit of code to tell me how far my periapsis was from the center of the arch. Then I used the readout to guide my manual course corrections.

1/3 of an orbit to go...

Target in sight...

VICTORY!
